summary.blockquote: NOTENote: The suggested replacement for this deprecated method is to instead set the positionX, positionY, and positionZ attributes directly.

remarks.para: The setPosition() method of the Interface defines the position of the audio source relative to the listener (represented by an object stored in the attribute.) The three parameters x, y and z are unitless and describe the source's position in 3D space using the right-hand Cartesian coordinate system.
The setPosition() method's default value of the position is (0, 0, 0).
